gameplay

Class GameTimer

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameplay.GameTimer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener

    public class GameTimer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.io.Serializable

    The GameTimer keeps track of time during the game to determine when the game should end.

    Author:
    Rakinul Huq
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public GameTimer(javax.swing.JLabel timeLabel,
                 javax.swing.JLabel livesLabel,
                 javax.swing.JLabel scoreLabel,
                 javax.swing.JLabel timeOverLabel)

        Constructs an object of type GameTimer which counts down the time remaining for each game.

        Parameters:
        timeLabel - the label for the time count
        livesLabel - the label for the number of lives left
        scoreLabel - the label for the players score
        timeOverLabel - the label to show show "Time Over" when time count becomes 0

    • Method Detail

      • actionPerformed

        public void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
        Counts down time as long as the timer has not reached zero and that the game is not paused. Displays a message when the timer does eventually reach zero.
        Specified by:
        actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener
